In conclusion, there exists moderate quality evidence that exclusively breastfed neonates 
are at lower risk of all-cause mortality and infection-related mortality in the first month 
of life compared with partially breastfed neonates. Also, there is low quality evidence that 
exclusively breastfed neonates are at lower risk of sepsis, ARI and diarrhoea morbidity in
